moves.1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bc4 Nf6 4. d3 Bc5: Game DB shows g5, but I have done well against people by taking that pawn with the knight. So I might save that for later. d6 to develop
moves.8... d6 9. Bd5:
Okay, this is still somewhat of a book play. Similar to another game I am playing. A GK game shows Ne7, with the bishop retreating but I don't like because of BxN which forces the trade. Although I could get good play with the open file, he still has not committed to castling. So it could wind up destroying the king side with no compensating attack.

Be3, Bg4 Think I prefer Be3
moves.9... Be6 10. c4:
Bb5, Bd5, BxB

I like BxB, allows knight to move without having to protect b pawn. 

After trade move Knight to d4
moves.10... Bxd5 11. exd5: Like the previous annotation said, Nd4, nice little post for the knight. If he trades, the bishop in that spot is nice as well.
moves.11... Nd4 12. O-O:
NxN followed by g5

Nf5, c6, Think I like Nf5 best, get rid of that pesky bishop.
moves.13... Nxh4 14. Nxh4:
Nxd5 like that, did not anticipate it but we take what we can get.

Followed by a nice place for my knight at f4 attacking his backwards pawn (Knight can escape to b4 if attacked.)

14. Nxh4 Nxd5 
15. cxd5 Qxh4 
16. g3 Qd4 

14. Nxh4 Nxd5 
15. g3 Nb4 (this might be the better spot for the knight even if he just retreats the knight)

Or this line
14. Nxh4 Nxd5 
15. Ndf3 Nf4 
16. g3 Nh3+ 
17. Kg2 Nxf2 
18. Rxf2 Bxf2 
19. Kxf2 Qf6
moves.15... Qxh4 16. Nf3:
Queen under attack, expected but thought it would be with a different piece.

Qb4 No takes Queen out of play
Qf6 Can push pawn and have an attack on knight and b pawn, but that would make his pawns better.
Qg4 Ok thought he could take pawn with Knight for a double attack on my queen but can just trade queens then take the knight

Like Qf6 best.
moves.16... Qf6 17. a5:
Kind of wierd. Maybe looking to get the rook out

Qf4 looking to park on b file, maybe
moves.17... Qf4 18. Ra4:
Knew he was moving rook out so why did i put the queen there.

Qf5 if Nh4 Then Qd7
moves.18... Qf5 19. Re1: fR-e8 looks good because if d4 then exd4 and RxR is check and then pick of other pawn.
moves.20... exd4 21. b4:
21. b4 Ba7 
22. Nxd4 Rxe1+ 
23. Qxe1 Bxd4
moves.21... Ba7 22. Ra3:
22. Ra3 Rxe1+ 
23. Qxe1 Qxd5 

takes the extra piece off the d pawn, then c5 works.
moves.23... Qxd5 24. Rd3 c5 25. bxc5: Don't see anything wrong with retaking.
moves.25... dxc5 26. Nd2: c4 looks good, if Ra3 then d3 because will be easier to then advance c pawn, and it opens up the bishop.
moves.26... c4 27. Rg3:
Still going to do d3, looks good

or qxa5, maybe next
moves.27... d3 28. Qe4: Trade queens and then put rook on e file
moves.28... Qxe4 29. Nxe4:
Rook on efile does not work right now.

Nf6+ and I lose my rook.

Bd4 then Re8. Bd4 also helps support the pawn push
moves.29... Bd4 30. Rf3: Re8 Threatens mate if he moves Knight. Puts Knight on a great open file. Will help support the pawn push
moves.30... Re8 31. Ng3: Okay he moved the knight but it looks like pushng the pawn will work the best.
moves.31... d2 32. h3: Okay, nothing wrong with getting a queen.
